text: [MUSIC PLAYING]
Hey, guys.
It's Angel.

today I'm sharing with you a
new bubble tea drink recipe.

It is Sea Salt
Cream Top Black Tea.
Sea salt cream top black tea.
Wow. that was a huge mouthful.

But if I had to describe
how this drink tastes,

I would say it kind of tastes
like a salted caramel beverage.
It's really good.

So if you like
salted caramel, you

will love, love,
love this drink.

And I actually kind of
like it a little bit better

than the original milk tea,
so definitely try this out.

So with that, let's get
started on the ingredients.

For this recipe, we'll start
by brewing some black tea.

And I recommend using this
brand of tea, which is PG Tips.

And they make a really
nice, bold black tea.

We will also need
some sea salt. Make

sure you're using real sea
salt and not kosher salt.

I'm using Maldon
Sea Salt Flakes.

And for finishing salt,
which is optional,

I have some black lava sea
salt. And I've gone ahead

to just crush that up
into smaller pieces
with the back of the spoon.

We'll also need 1/4 cup
of heavy whipping cream.

Now, make sure your heavy
whipping cream is super cold
before you go ahead and use it.

And I like to make sure
it's cold by sticking it

in the freezer for
about five minutes
before I'm ready to use.

Finally, we will need two
tablespoons of cane sugar
to sweeten our black tea.

And also, optional, but not
necessary, highly recommended
though, is some precooked boba.
First, let's brew our tea.

If you're using the tea
bags that I recommended,

we'll need two tea
bags and 1 and 1/2
cups of hot, boiling water.

Let both tea bags brew
for a full five minutes.

Then, remove the tea bags,
and add in your cane sugar.

Give it a good stir so
the sugar dissolves.

Then let it cool completely
before putting it
in the refrigerator to chill.

Now, I've gone ahead
to brew the tea earlier
so we don't have to wait.

So this is cold,
sweetened black tea.

Next, get out your serving
glass, and go ahead
and add your boba first.
One more scoop.
Yay!

Then, go ahead and
add your black tea.

Next, add in a couple
ice cubes if you'd like.

It's already cold, but I'm just
going to add a few anyways.
And now for our whipping cream.

This is just whipping
cream here, extra cold.

I'm going to add about three
pinches of sea salt flakes.

I'm just going to seal
that up, make sure
that the lid is really tight.

We're going to shake
it for 15 to 30 seconds
to make whipped cream.

So once you have
the whipped cream,

you are just going to go
ahead and add that right
on the top of this drink.

And finally, I am just
going to top it off

with a few pinches of
the black lava sea salt

to give it a little
bit of contrast.
And voila!

So that is how you make Sea
Salt Cream Top Black Tea.

If you like salted caramel
frappuccinos, salted

caramel ice cream, I am
sure you will absolutely
love this drink as well.
